author: Anonymous Comp
title: Return nth element of a list
question: If I had a list of elements, and wanted to take the nth element in the list (i.e. something like (predicate-name n lon)), is there a predicate that we learnt that could accomplish this? I feel like this was covered in past material but I wasn't able to find it in starters or in Racket documentation. Thanks for your help.
student_answer: You can use list-ref for that. Where (list-ref (list "a" "b" "c") 1) returns "b" (zero based indexing). It’s in the documentation/help desk as well.
